page.title: 02Batley
page.content: Batley is an industrial town named after {Batta's Ley}(Ley means a pasture or a clearing in a forest). Batley is part of Kirklees,in West Yorkshire. The nearest big city is Leeds,which is about 6 miles away. Batley is a route focus,with,nearby roads to:_ Dewsbury,Bradford,Wakefield,Leeds, Huddersfield,and over the Pennines to Manchester and Liverpool.It is also a bridging point. Batley used to have a lot of textile mills.The town was famous for{shoddy} (re _ cycled wool).Few of these mills are left. Now there are a lot of different industries like, paint making,engineering,beds and quilt making. Fox's Biscuits is now the largest industry in the town.
